intro: Lessingia glomerata, commonly known as the clustered lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Lessingia glomerata is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
